tool.name: AddAreaMultiple

param.name: features
param.dialogReference: A semicolon separated list of polygon feature classes. This parameter is required, and there is no default.
param.pythonReference: A semicolon separated list of polygon feature classes. This parameter is required, and there is no default.

param.name: field_name
param.dialogReference: The name of the field to add or update. If the field does not exist, it will be added. If the field exists, it must be a double field. The Field_Name may get mangled to ensure it is valid for the feature's workspace. If no Field_Name is provided, the default is "Area".
param.pythonReference: The name of the field to add or update. If the field does not exist, it will be added. If the field exists, it must be a double field. The Field_Name may get mangled to ensure it is valid for the feature's workspace. If no Field_Name is provided, the default is "Area".

param.name: units
param.expression: {Acres | Ares | Hectares | Square Centimeters | Square Decimeters | Square Inches | Square Feet | Square Kilometers | Square Meters | Square Miles | Square Millimeters | Square Yards}
param.dialogReference: The units for the area of the polygon. See the system tool Calculate Field (Data Management)for valid units. If units are not valid, or not provided, then the units of the feature class are used.
param.pythonReference: The units for the area of the polygon. See the system tool Calculate Field (Data Management)for valid units. If units are not valid, or not provided, then the units of the feature class are used.

param.name: overwrite
param.dialogReference: If the Field_Name already exists in a feature class, it will not be overwritten, unless this parameter is "True". The default is "False".
param.pythonReference: If the Field_Name already exists in a feature class, it will not be overwritten, unless this parameter is "True". The default is "False".

tool.summary: Add or update an area field in a set of polygon feature classes.
tool.usage: This tool will add (or update) a field with the area of the polygon features. The field and areal units are defined by the user. By default if the feature class has geographic coordinates and units are provided then a geodesic area is calculated. If the feature class has geographic coordinates and no units are provided then the area is calculated in square degrees, which is generally meaningless.

scriptExample.title: Scripting Example
scriptExample.para: The following example shows how this script can be used in the ArcGIS Python Window. It assumes that the script has been loaded into a toolbox, and the toolbox has been loaded into the active session of ArcGIS.

scriptExample.title: Command Line Example
scriptExample.para: The following example shows how the script can be used from the operating system command line. It assumes that the current directory is the location of the script, and that the python interpreter is in the path.
scriptExample.code: C:\tmp> python add_area.py "C:\tmp\parks.shp;C:\tmp\test.gdb\preserves" SQUAREKILOMETERS SqKm True

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Add or update an area field in a set of polygon feature classes.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Regan Sarwas, Alaska Region GIS Team, National Park Service
